neighbors.name: Richard A. Jasinski
neighbors.claims: Richard A. Jasinski is the recorded owner of parcel 16.-1-23 in Genesee County ([Cider Solar Farm Project Area Tax Parcels Map](http://cidersolarfarm.com/assets/pdfs/public_exhibits/Exh_04.pdf)). The property is located within the Project Area for the 500-MW Cider Solar Farm in the towns of Elba and Oakfield ([Cider Solar Farm Project Area Tax Parcels Map](http://cidersolarfarm.com/assets/pdfs/public_exhibits/Exh_04.pdf)). There is no record of Jasinski holding any public office or speaking in local meetings on development issues.
neighbors.influence_justification: Private landowner; no public roles identified

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respected farming community figure (e.g. Farm Bureau rep) reach out to reassure him about fair lease terms and end-of-project land restoration plans. Emphasize that after the solar project’s lifespan, the land can be returned to agricultural use with minimal lasting impact.

citations.claim: Richard A. Jasinski is the recorded owner of parcel 16.-1-23 in Genesee County
citations.title: Cider Solar Farm Project Area Tax Parcels Map

citations.claim: The property is located within the Project Area for the 500-MW Cider Solar Farm
citations.title: Cider Solar Farm Project Area Tax Parcels Map

neighbors.verification_notes: Corrected name from 'Brett Jasinski' to 'Richard A. Jasinski' based on official project tax parcel maps (Source: Cider Solar Exhibit 04). Brett appears to be a relative (grandson) based on local obituaries, but Richard is the legal owner of the PIN.

neighbors.name: Makayla Friedl
neighbors.claims: Makayla Friedl is listed as the owner of parcel 12.-1-6.2 in Oakfield, Genesee County, which is classified as 1.97 acres of agricultural land ([Genesee County Agricultural and Farmland Protection Board Packet](https://www.geneseeny.gov/files/content/county/v/12/department-content/planning/agricultural-and-farmland-protection/2025-03-18-meeting-packet.pdf)). Her name does not appear in local news archives or public meeting records on development, suggesting she has not taken a visible stance on the proposed project. She holds no known civic or leadership positions in the community.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage her in a neighborly conversation highlighting how the project will address farmland preservation and protect property values in the area. Explain the developer’s efforts to minimize long-term impacts and note that nearby residents may be eligible for compensation or benefit programs to ensure fairness.

citations.claim: Makayla Friedl is listed as the owner of parcel 12.-1-6.2 in Oakfield, Genesee County
citations.title: Genesee County Agricultural and Farmland Protection Board Meeting Packet

neighbors.verification_notes: Ownership confirmed via Genesee County Farmland Protection Board 2025 meeting packet.

neighbors.name: Scott Mabon
neighbors.claims: Scott M. Mabon is the recorded owner of parcel 12.-1-6.12 in Oakfield, Genesee County, comprising 3.10 acres ([Genesee County Agricultural and Farmland Protection Board Packet](https://www.geneseeny.gov/files/content/county/v/12/department-content/planning/agricultural-and-farmland-protection/2025-03-18-meeting-packet.pdf)). This parcel is located in the vicinity of Friedl’s parcel (12.-1-6.2) ([Genesee County Agricultural and Farmland Protection Board Packet](https://www.geneseeny.gov/files/content/county/v/12/department-content/planning/agricultural-and-farmland-protection/2025-03-18-meeting-packet.pdf)). No public information links Mabon to any official positions or statements on the project; he has not been noted in media or town minutes regarding local development debates.

approach_recommendations.engage: Arrange a one-on-one discussion (through a trusted local official or neighbor) to listen to any concerns he has about losing productive farmland or property impacts. Emphasize plans to minimize disruption and ensure the land’s long-term viability after the project, addressing any questions about how the solar farm will be decommissioned and the land restored.

citations.claim: Scott M. Mabon is the recorded owner of parcel 12.-1-6.12 in Oakfield, Genesee County
citations.title: Genesee County Agricultural and Farmland Protection Board Meeting Packet

neighbors.verification_notes: Ownership confirmed via Genesee County Farmland Protection Board 2025 meeting packet.
